Well I don't know much about anything, but I sure liked this film. In short, it was creative, humorous, simple, and heartwarming.
I could tell that the people working behind-the-scenes really cared about their film. They may not be professionals by trade or degree (possibly possible), but they went above and beyond to make a wonderful short film.

I had mixed feelings for "Les Valseuses" (1974) written and directed by Bertrand Blier when I started watching it but I ended up loving it. "Les Valseuses" was remade as the 1979 American classic "Stardust Memories", Woody Allen's homage to this wonderful film. The new Criterion Blu-ray edition of Bertrand Blier's "Les Valseuses" is part of Criterion's Eclipse series that features rare films
